knimeNode.name: Dict Replacer (2 In-Ports)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Replaces complete document terms that match with dictionary keys by corresponding specified values.

fullDescription.intro:
Replaces complete terms contained in the input documents that match with specified dictionary terms with a corresponding specified value.
The dictionary is provided by a additional data table at the second data port, consisting of at least two string columns. One string column contains the strings to replace (keys) the other string column contains the replacement strings (values). The columns can be specified in the dialog.

tab.name: Preprocessing options
tab.option: The column containing the documents to preprocess.
If checked, the documents will be replaced by the new preprocessed documents. Otherwise the preprocessed documents will be appended as new column.
The name of the new appended column, containing the preprocessed documents.
If checked, unmodifiable terms will be preprocessed too.

tab.name: Dictionary

option.name: Column containing the strings to replace

tab.option: The column containing the strings (words/terms) to replace (keys).
The column containing the replacement strings (values).

option.name: Replace words not in the dictionary by

tab.option: If checked, all words that are not available in the dictionary are replaced by the string entered in the text field.
Select the tokenizer used for word tokenization. Go to Preferences -> KNIME -> Textprocessing to read the description for each tokenizer.

ports.inPort: The input table which contains the documents to preprocess.
The input table containing at least of two string columns (dictionary).
ports.outPort: The output table which contains the preprocessed documents.
